snippet: The return of thousands of civilian Defense Department employees, and the promise of back pay for furloughed workers, was welcome news in Lakewood, Wash., but worry was still in the air.
abstract: Pentagon's announcement that thousands of civilian Defense Dept employees will return to work, even as the federal government shutdown continues, is welcome news to residents of Lakewood, Wash, but worry is still in the air; much of city's economy is tied to nearby Joint Base Lewis-McChord.
lead_paragraph: The return of thousands of civilian Defense Department employees, and the promise of back pay for furloughed workers, was welcome news in Lakewood, Wash., but worry was still in the air.

headline.main: In Military City, Government Reassurances Are Little Comfort
headline.print_headline: In Military City, Government Reassurances Are Little Comfort
